intro: Daphne blagayana, commonly known as the Natal daphne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Daphne blagayana typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens, though it is toxic to humans and animals.
